Articles.Content:
Quick question (probably dumb question):  is it safe to force dx 11 mid-save, and to switch between that command and normal mode (removing that command from the launcher shortcut?).  I'm experimenting with seeing how these commands affect performance, but I don't want to mess any save up.  I am running around 50 mods or so (JNSQ, Kopernicus, scatterer, the works) if that makes a difference.

Thank you from someone who isn't particularly tech-savvy!
I’ve done it plenty of times and there are no issues with it. Back up your save first though, it’s always a good idea to have a backup when you’re going to experiment on the game.

Why are you having to force DirectX?... on the last KSP update that updated to Unity 2017, DircteX11 support became default... So you shouldnt need to be forcing it, unless you are on a pretty old version of KSP, or on a different OS than Windoze?
And yes, it should be safe to switch mid-save. As to performance, I ALWAYS had better performance forcing Dx11, than running Dx9... but again, if you are on a newer version of KSP, I dont think you'll see any change, since KSP now natively runs Dx11 anyways...

The way to tell, IIRC, is it says right at the top of the KSP.log, which version of Dx is being run for that instance of the game.

Edited October 27, 2020 by Stone Blue
